intro: Xanthoxerampellia muelleri, commonly known as the yellow box, is a small to medium-sized tree native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are important for local wildlife. Xanthoxerampellia muelleri is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands.
